Engaging Local Communities in REDD+/Enhancement of Carbon Stocks
Integrated programme to build resilience To climate change & adaptive capacity of vulnerable communities
properties.Details: Kenya comprises 83% of arid and semi-arid land and has an economy and livelihoods that are heavily reliable on rain-fed agriculture, which is in turn vulnerable to extreme droughts exacerbated by climate change and variability.This programme seeks to enhance resilience and adaptive capacity to climate change for selected communities in various Counties in Kenya in order to increase food security and environmental management.

properties.Project name: Climate smart integrated rural development project
properties.Details: Both agriculture and livestock sectors are heavily impacted by the frequent major droughts and floods in Ethiopia. This project aims to increase resilience to recurrent droughts in 7 agro-ecological landscapes in Ethiopia, using an integrated water, agriculture and natural resource management approach.

properties.Project name: Adapting to climate change through integrated water management
properties.Details: Despite being considered a country with one of the largest water resources, Panama is subject to a series of regional and seasonal limitations, capita. This relative abundance scenario hides a series of regional and seasonal limitations, specifically those associated to the most arid region of the country known as the “Arco Seco”. This relative water abundance scenario and increasing conflicts are aggravated by climate variability and extreme weather events, mainly droughts and floods. This project situates water management at the center of the adaptation efforts, promoting climate resilience and vulnerability reduction through enhancing food and energy security,.

properties.Project name: Reducing the vulnerability by cocusing on critical sectors (agriculture, water resources, and coastlines) in order to reduce the negative impacts of climate change and improve the resilience of these sectors
properties.Details: Costa Rica is experiencing the effects of increasing temperatures and intensity of extreme rainfall. These effects, due to climate change, are increasing the vulnerability of the water resources of the country, threatening the sustainable production of agricultural resources that promote food security and livelihoods, as well as negatively affecting mangroves and coral reefs, which serve as protective barriers to coastal communities. The objective of this programme is to reduce climate vulnerability by focusing on critical sectors (agriculture, water resources, and coastal zones) in order to reduce the negative impacts of climate change, and improve the resilience of those populations.

properties.Project name: Climate changes adaptation project in oasis zones – PACC-ZO
properties.Details: The project aims to improve the adaptability of populations in the oasis zone in southern Morocco in the face of climate change. These oases are currently facing the additional challenge of climate change, which may bring with it even greater constraints (water scarcity, extreme weather events), alongside the results of a degrading ecosystem due to recurrent periods of drought, an arid climate and "irrational" modes of exploitation such as overfishing.

properties.Project name: An integrated approach to physical adaptation and community resilience in Antigua and Barbuda's northwest McKinnon's watershed
properties.Details: This project will focus its efforts on a high risk and populated watershed on the northwest coast of Antigua, an area vulnerable to climate change, undergoing urban expansion, and supports low income and lower middle-income families. It aims to increase the ability of the watershed to handle extreme rainfall, while increasing the resilience of the built environment simultaneously to cope with the multiple stressors of climate change.

properties.Project name: Reducing vulnerability to climate change in north west Rwanda through community based adaptation
properties.Details: Recent changes in the variability of rainfall have had a dramatic effect on the already highly perturbed ecosystems of Rwanda, particularly in the mountainous North West part of the country which has experienced floods and landslides. This project aims to increase the adaptive capacity of natural systems and rural communities living in exposed areas of North Western Rwanda to climate change impacts by managing the risks and effects from recurring floods, landslides and erosion through an integrated natural resource management and alternative livelihoods programme. The project aims to address factors that exacerbate the effects of intense rainfall and lead to flooding and landslides, such as erosion and unsustainable farming practices.

properties.Project name: Building resilience to climate change and variability in vulnerable smallholders
properties.Details: Contribute to building national capacity to adapt to climate change and variability by focusing on the vulnerable smallholders in the livestock sector. Integrated livestock management measures, including better infrastructure for water and shadow, improved pasture management and biodiversity conservation, are at the core of the technical options to increase the resilience of small farmers to climate change. The project would finance a higher share of the investment costs for “transition” smallholders and would promote the establishment of recovery schemes at the local level involving grass root organisations.

properties.Project name: Enhancing the resilience of the agricultural sector and coastal areas to protect livelihoods and improve food security
properties.Details: Jamaica is a small island developing state in the Caribbean and particularly vulnerable to hurricanes, floods, storm surges, droughts, and other climate-related hazards. The programme by several Jamaican government agencies seeks to protect the livelihoods and food security of people living in seven of the country’s 14 parishes by improving water harvesting and management, as well as erosion and flood control. The programme will also support climate resilient coastal management in Negril.

properties.Project name: Enhancement of Flood and Drought Management in Pursat Province
Enhancing resilience of climate change of the small agriculture in Chilean region of O'Higgins
properties.Details: This project aims to increase the resilience capacity of rural farm communities in the  O’Higgins region. According to climate change projections, the region among the areas that will be most affected by precipitation decreases. The effects of climate change are projected to further exacerbate water scarcity and soil degradation that the small farmers of the area are already facing, as well as effect ecosystem services and biodiversity.

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of agriculture to climate change to support food security through modern irrigation techniques
properties.Details: Niger's agricultural production is faced with the adverse impacts of climate change due to insufficient water availability. The weather variability and climate change have a direct impact on food security, especially in rural areas. This project aims to provide a sustainable solution to the issue of low agricultural production and food insecurity.

properties.Project name: Rural Electrification Expansion Project
Adapting to climate induced threats to food production and food security in the Karnali Region
properties.Details: The project’s goal is to increasing the adaptive capacity of climate vulnerable and food insecure poor households by improved management of livelihood assets and natural resources in the Karnali mountain districts of Nepal. The project will bring together best practices derived from a number of past and on-going initiatives to deliver concrete adaptation actions.

properties.Project name: Climate resilient agriculture in three of the vulnerable extreme northern crop-growing regions
properties.Details: Increasing the climate-resilience and reducing the food insecurity of subsistence farmers

properties.Project name: Environmental Land Management and Rural Livelihoods Project
Development of systems to prevent forest fires and monitor vegetation cover in the Brazilian Cerrado
Increasing the resilience of poor and vulnerable communities to climate change impacts through implementing innovative projects in water and agriculture in support of adaptation to climate change
properties.Details: Ground water aquifers are already under stress in Jordan due to over abstraction. The primary aim of this project is to develop the sustainability of waste water reuse activities and on-farm integrated agriculture in Wadi Mousa as a mean of climate change adaptation.

properties.Project name: Climate change adaptation programme in the coastal zone of Mauritius
properties.Details: Combating beach erosion and flood risk in several coastal areas with a suite of infrastructure and natural protection, including sloped rock mounds offshore that are designed to deflect waves, mangroves and other shoreline vegetation to reduce erosion, and an increased number of public buildings on stilts. Will also support monitoring of the link between coastal processes and climate change over time, help to develop an early warning system and provide policy and information support.

properties.Project name: Building Climate Resilient Communities through Private Sector Participation
Enhancing the climate change resilience of vulnerable island communities
properties.Details: The overall goal of the project is to build social, ecological and economic resilience of the target island communities of the Federated States of Micronesia and reduce their vulnerabilities to extreme drought, sea level rise and other climate risks. It will do this through water resource management, coastal resource and development planning, and by promoting gender perspectives and ecologically sound climate resilient livelihoods.

properties.Project name: Increasing climate resilience through an Integrated Water Resource Management Programme
properties.Details: Will implement a range of schemes – such as installation of groundwater protection and recharge measures using surplus rainwater and improved management of wastewater – to ensure reliable and safe freshwater supply for the communities of Mahibadhoo, Ihavandhoo and Gadhdhoo.

properties.Project name: Additional Financing to the Regional Disaster Vulnerability Reduction Project (RDVRP)
properties.Details: Climate Information Systems and Disaster Risk Management

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of Samoa's coastal communities to climate change
properties.Details: Aims to strengthen the ability of Samoan communities and public services to make informed decisions and manage likely climate change-driven pressures in a proactive, integrated and strategic manner. The bulk of the programme will focus on making improvements to infrastructure in ways that will help Samoan communities adapt to climate change.

properties.Project name: Geothermal Exploratory Drilling Project (GEDP)
Adaptation to coastal erosion in vulnerable areas
properties.Details: The project, which encompasses the areas of Rufisque, Saly, and Joal, aims to protect people, houses, economic and cultural infrastructure in the region against coastal erosion.

properties.Project name: Programme support for climate change adaptation in the vulnerable regions of Mopti and Timbuktu
properties.Details: Located in the Sahel of West Africa, Mali has a dry climate with 65 % of its territory under semi-desert and desert conditions. Climate change is expected to increase the variability and the incidence of extreme weather events, such as droughts, floods, intense rainfall events. This programme aims to increase the resilience of vulnerable communities and their adaptive capacity to climate change in the regions

properties.Project name: Reducing risk and vulnerability to climate change in the region of La Depresion Momposina
properties.Details: The Mojana subregion of Depresión Momposina, home to thousands of farming families, has endured multiple cases of severe flooding in recent years. The project will focus on the municipalities of Ayapel, San Marcos, and San Benito Abad in the effort to minimize destruction from future flooding, which is expected to become more severe as the climate changes, and to protect the biological diversity of a region known for its rich variety of species and ecosystems. Will do thise through a wide range of activities, including the development of hydrological and hydraulic models, climate change profiles, flood-risk maps, and vulnerability assessments, updating the hydrometeorological network, and designing and operating a local early warning system.

properties.Project name: Increased resilience to climate change in Northern Ghana through the management water resources and diversification of livelihoods
properties.Details: The programme targets the three regions in the northern part of Ghana: the Upper East, Upper West and Northern Regions. Compared to other regions of the country, these three northern regions have high degree of exposure to climate variability and change characterized by increasing temperatures and decreasing and erratic rainfall. The main objective of the programme is to enhance the resilience and adaptive capacity of rural livelihoods to climate impacts and risks on water resources in the northern region of Ghana.

properties.Project name: Centre Artibonite Regional Development Project
Promoting Climate-Resilient Agriculture in Koh Kong and Mondulkiri Provinces as part of the Greater Mekong Subregion Biodiversity Conservation Corridors Project
Addressing climate change impacts on marginalised agricultural communities living in the Mahaweli River basin
properties.Details: The project targets rain-dependent farming families in two hazard-prone areas in the Mahaweli Basin, aiming to address specific vulnerabilities faced by these farmers developing household food security and build resilient livelihoods for their households and building institutional capacity in village, local, regional service delivery to reduce risks associated with climate-induced rainfall variability.

properties.Project name: Addressing climate change risks on water and food security in the dry zone of Myanmar
properties.Details: From increasing temperature and water evaporation, to declining water availability, more frequent droughts, and intensifying weather events especially flash floods and cyclones, the local economies of this region are expected to be impacted by climate change. This project seeks to minimise the increasing impacts of climate change on agricultural and livestock production cycles in the Myanmar Dry Zone.

properties.Project name: Biogas Extended Program
Climate smart agriculture: enhancing adaptive capacity of the rural communities
properties.Details: Agriculture in Lebanon is one of the most vulnerable sectors to climate change due to the limited availability of water and land resources and the pressures of population growth and urbanisation. The project aims to assist communities in adapting by improving water harvesting and irrigation technologies; setting up early warning systems and integrated production and protection of crops; and introducing adapted crop varieties to future climate conditions among other measures.

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of communities to the adverse effects of climate change on food security
properties.Details: Mauritania is a large West African country particularly vulnerable to climate change-induced drought, decreasing rainfall and flash flood. The project aims to improve adaptation in the area of food security by assisting the government to improve technical services at the community level to help village residents prepare detailed adaptation plans; promote climate resilience by protecting threatened resources, such as dunes, community fuel wood forests, and water sources; and help villages explore ways to diversify sources of livelihood.

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of communities to climate change through catchment-based integrated management of water and related resources
properties.Details: The major symptoms of climate change in Uganda include increase in temperatures and increased variability and unpredictability of rainfall patterns that lead to increased frequency and intensity of disasters such as floods and landslides. These have severe impacts on ecosystems, agricultural landscapes and livelihoods especially among the rural populations. The overall goal of the project is to increase the resilience of communities to the risk of floods and landslides in Awoja, Maziba and Aswa catchments.

properties.Project name: Increasing resilience of ecosystems and communities through restoration of the productive bases of salinised lands
properties.Details: Will restore salinised lands through improved knowledge and planning. It also aims to implement measures such as hydraulic works, reforestation, anti-soil erosion systems, and the use of adapted agriculture.

properties.Project name: Electricity Modernization Project
Nicaragua Geothermal Exploration and Transmission Improvement Program under the PINIC
Building resilience in the greater uMngeni catchment
properties.Details: This project aims to reduce climate vulnerability and increase the resilience and adaptive capacity in rural and peri-urban settlements and small-scale farmers in productive landscapes in the uMgungundlovu District Municipality (UMDM), KwaZulu Natal Province, South Africa, that are threatened by climate variability and change, through an integrated adaptation approach.

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of communities to the adverse effects of climate change on food security, in Pichincha Province and the Jubones River basin
properties.Details: To strengthen the resilience and food security of 120 food insecure and vulnerable communities located in the Pichincha province and the Jubones river basin.

properties.Project name: Mainstreaming Climate Change Risk Management in Development
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Ecosystem based approaches for reducing the vulnerability of food security to the impacts of climate change in the Chaco region
properties.Details: Almost a quarter of the Paraguayan population is considered to be in poverty, with around 1.6 million people living in households whose income is lower than the cost of a basic basket of consumption estimated for that year. This project aims to contribute to reducing the vulnerability of food security to the impacts of climate change in El Chaco region, with concrete interventions will be implemented in seven communities.

properties.Project name: Improving Climate Data and Information Management Project
properties.Details: Climate Information Systems and Disaster Risk Management

properties.Project name: Improvement of Weather, Climate, and Hydrological Delivery project
properties.Details: Climate Information Systems and Disaster Risk Management

properties.Project name: Mainstreaming Climate Resilience into Development Planning
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Adaptation to the impacts of climate change on Peru's coastal marine ecosystem and fisheries
properties.Details: Peru sustains the most productive fisheries in the world, yielding nearly 10% of world’s fish catch. But climatic ecological impacts can have dramatic socio-economic consequences for the fishing industry and for the artisanal fishing communities. This project aims to reduce the vulnerability of coastal communities to climate change impacts on the coastal marine ecosystems and fishery resources.

properties.Project name: Building resilient food security systems to benefit the southern Egypt region
properties.Details: The World Food Programme (WFP) estimates that Southern Egypt, a region that is already economically stressed and whose food supplies are under constant threat of disruption, stands to lose a minimum of 30 percent of its food production by 2050 as a result of climate change impacts. In response, the Government has proposed a project that aims to improve the adaptive capacity of the Southern zone in the face of anticipated climate-induced reduction in food production through eg water saving irrigation and other adaptation techniques; and build institutional capacity at the national, regional, and local levels to better understand climate trends and impacts.

properties.Project name: Agricultural climate resilience enhancement initiative
properties.Details: Due to climate change, the frequency and severity of natural disasters such as drought are expected to increase in the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) region, already highly vulnerable. Persistent and deteriorating food and nutrition insecurity remain a major concern particularly in arid and semiarid lands. This project aims to improve adaptive capacity and resilience to current climate variability and change among targeted farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralist communities.

properties.Project name: Agricultural climate resilience enhancement initiative
properties.Details: Due to climate change, the frequency and severity of natural disasters such as drought are expected to increase in the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) region, already highly vulnerable. Persistent and deteriorating food and nutrition insecurity remain a major concern particularly in arid and semiarid lands. This project aims to improve adaptive capacity and resilience to current climate variability and change among targeted farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralist communities.

properties.Project name: Agricultural climate resilience enhancement initiative
properties.Details: Due to climate change, the frequency and severity of natural disasters such as drought are expected to increase in the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) region, already highly vulnerable. Persistent and deteriorating food and nutrition insecurity remain a major concern particularly in arid and semiarid lands. This project aims to improve adaptive capacity and resilience to current climate variability and change among targeted farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralist communities.

properties.Project name: Private Sector Sustainable Energy Financing Facility (TurSEFF) – Extension
Sustainable Energy Finance Program
Solar Power Development Project
Enhancing adaptive capacity of communities to climate change-related floods in the North Coast and Islands region
properties.Details: The project will focus on helping both the government and residents of the riverine North Coast and the coastal Islands communities make informed decisions about how best to plan and respond to a coastal or inland flood. The coastal flooding component aims to establish a coastal early warning system; coastal flood preparedness and response plans and systems; and a support system for community-led mangrove reforestation and conservation projects.The inland flooding component will focus on river communities and set up early warning systems; establish an inland flood preparedness and response plan and systems in Oro Province, as well as integrated riverbank protection measures across four provinces.

properties.Project name: Climate change adaptation programme in water and agriculture In Anseba Region
properties.Details: To promote increased food security in sub-zobas of Hamelmalo and Haberoof the Anseba Region of Eritrea through ecologically sustainable and climate-resilient improvements in agricultural production, using an integrated water management and agricultural development approach.

properties.Project name: Dedicated Grant Mechanism for Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities: Funding Proposal for the DGM Project for Brazil
Ecosystem based adaptation to climate change
properties.Details: This project seeks to reduce the vulnerability of the Seychelles to climate change, focusing on two key issues—water scarcity and flooding. The climate change projections in the Seychelles show that rainfall, while increasing in overall terms, will become even more irregular.

properties.Project name: Building the resilience of wetlands
properties.Location: Province of Datem del Marañón, Peru
properties.Details: Will enhance the climate resilience and livelihoods of the indigenous wetlands communities of Datem del Marañón in the Amazon basin, as well as prevent greenhouse gas emissions from deforestation.

properties.Project name: Grid-Connected RE Development Support (ADERC)
Sustainable Energy Finance Program
Pacific Resilience Program (PREP)
Expansion of the Approved Philippines Renewable Energy Accelerator Program (REAP)
Reduction of vulnerability to coastal flooding through ecosystem-based adaptation in the South of Artemisa and Mayabeque Provinces
properties.Details: This project focuses specifically on an 84 km long stretch of coastline between Punta Sucia and Punta Mora in the western provinces of Artemisa and Mayabeque, covering 6 municipalities. This coastline, which lies on the Gulf of Batabanó, is comprised of a large coastal wetland area based on clay and terrestrial deposits, dominated by mangroves. This is one of the most vulnerable regions in the country to tropical storms and hurricanes, and associated storm surges. The project will rely on a combination of natural regeneration and artificial regeneration (planting) to achieve the recovery of structure, function and ecosystem services in mangroves and other associated coastal ecosystems.

properties.Project name: Building Capacity for Climate Resilience
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Forest-Dependent Community Support Project
Marine conservation and climate adaptation
properties.Details: The coastal zones of Belize are critical to its economy, as the livelihoods of fishers, other resource extactors, and the tourism sector, relies upon these ecosystems. It will also be a zone affected by climate-induced increased storm surges. This project’s objective is to implement priority ecosystem-based marine conservation and climate adaptation measures to strengthen the climate resilience of the Belize Barrier Reef System.

properties.Project name: Financing water adaptation in Jamaica’s new urban housing sector
Enhancing the adaptive capacity and increasing resilience of small-scale agriculture producers of the northeast of Argentina
properties.Details: In the northeast Argentina, 80% of the producers belong to small-scale family agriculture. During recent years, the region has experienced a noticeable increase in the annual mean precipitation and changes in annual mean temperatures. In addition, the frequency of extreme precipitation has increased. The main objective of the project is to increase the adaptive capacity and to build resilience of small-scale family agricultural producers in the face of climate change and climate variability impacts, particularly those deriving from the increase in the intensity of hydrometeorological events, such as floods and droughts.

properties.Project name: Addressing climate change risks on water resources in Honduras: increased systemic resilience and reduced vulnerability of the urban poor
properties.Details: The goal of the project is to increase resilience to climate change and water-related risks in the most vulnerable population in Honduras through pilot activities and an overarching intervention to mainstream climate change considerations into water sector policies.

properties.Project name: Enhancing resilience of communities in Solomon Islands to the adverse effects of climate change in agriculture and food security
properties.Details: The project implemented by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is working to strengthen ability of communities in the Solomon Islands to make informed decisions and manage likely climate change driven pressures on food production and management systems.

properties.Project name: Reduction of risks and vulnerability based on flooding and droughts in the Estero Real river watershed
properties.Details: Nicaragua, a country in which poverty levels are already high, also faces severe social and economic impacts related to significant climate variability. The programme will rely upon a coordinated set of interventions designed to implement new public policies for addressing climate change.

properties.Project name: Ecosystem based adaptation approach to maintaining water security in critical water catchments
properties.Details: Targets two eco-regions, the Altai Mountain/Great Lakes Basin and the Eastern Steppe, and aims to maintain the water supplies of the mountain and steppe ecosystems.

properties.Project name: Dedicated Grant Mechanism in Peru
Self Supply Renewable Energy Guarantee Program
Climate change resilient productive landscapes and socio-economic networks advanced in Guatemala
properties.Details: Projected climate variability and climate change will cause a regression in human development levels in Guatamale – where 51% of the population is already poor and 15% live in extreme poverty – that will impact a range of issues including food security, health, forestry, ecosystems, and water resources. The project aims to increase climate resilience of production landscapes and socio-economic systems in the target municipalities threatened by the impacts of climate change and climatic variability, in particular hydro-meteorological events that are increasing in frequency and intensity.

properties.Project name: Developing climate resilience of farming communities in the drought prone parts of Uzbekistan
properties.Details: The frequent occurrence of drought, an overall trend of desertification of Uzbekistan’s poorest region, Karakalpakstan, places serious strain on water availability, and is causing a decline in land productivity and thus the ability of rural poor to withstand the current and future impacts of climate change. This project aims to develop climate resilience in farming and pastoral communities in the drought-prone Karakalpakstan region of Uzbekistan.

properties.Project name: Strengthening the resilience of our islands and our communities to climate change
properties.Details: Aims to strengthen the ability of Pa Enua, and all Cook Island communities, to make informed decisions and manage anticipated climate change driven pressures in a proactive, integrated and strategic manner. To accomplish this goal, the programme aims to help strengthen national institutions, enhance coordination of efforts at the national level, and ensure more effective delivery of national initiatives at island and community level.

properties.Project name: Developing climate resilient flood and flash flood management practices to protect vulnerable communities
properties.Details: With flood frequency and the occurrence of landslides, flash-floods and mudflows projected to increase, the project objective is to help the governments and the population of the Rioni River Basin to develop adaptive capacity and embark on climate-resilient economic development. The project, implemented by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) aims to assist government officials by introducing a floodplain development policy.

properties.Project name: Sustainable Energy Finance Program (TSEF)
Renewable Energy Accelerator Program
Promoting climate resilience in the rice sector
properties.Details: Roughly 10 million people in Madagascar, or almost 70% of its population, derive at least part of their economic income from rice. This project aims to help those in the rice sector increase climate resilience through increased rice production that will withstand projected climate conditions and increased environmental sustainability and ecological services in the rice sector.

properties.Project name: Implementation of concrete adaptation measures to reduce vulnerability of livelihood and economy of coastal communities
properties.Details: The project intends to lessen the negative impacts of sea level rise and changes in precipitation patterns in the Ilala and Temeke Districts of Dar es Salaam. The project aims to reduce the adverse impacts of sea level rise and floods on coastal infrastructures and settlements; rehabilitate coastal ecosystems to enhance ecological resistance to flooding; conduct a baseline study based on coastal vulnerability and an assessment of the economic viability and practical feasibility of adaptation measures; creating and operating a climate change observatory for Tanzania; documenting lessons learned, building district level administration capacity; and producing an Ecosystem-based Integrated Coastal Area Management Plan.

properties.Project name: Additional Financing to the Regional Disaster Vulnerability Reduction Project (RDVRP)
properties.Details: Climate Information Systems and Disaster Risk Management

properties.Project name: Strengthening Hydro-Meteorological Services Project
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Rainwater Harvesting and Drip Irrigation for High-Value Crop Production in Cambodia
Small Business Climate Resilience Financing Facility
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Dedicated Grant Mechanism for Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities: Program Framework and Funding Proposal for the DGM Project for the Global Component
Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin
properties.Details: In the Lake Victoria Basin (LVB), climate change is inadequately integrated into regional transboundary water catchment management which is increasing the vulnerability of LVB communities. This problem is expected to intensify under the conditions of future climate change, specifically increasing variability in rainfall patterns and increasing mean annual temperatures. The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.

properties.Project name: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin
properties.Details: In the Lake Victoria Basin (LVB), climate change is inadequately integrated into regional transboundary water catchment management which is increasing the vulnerability of LVB communities. This problem is expected to intensify under the conditions of future climate change, specifically increasing variability in rainfall patterns and increasing mean annual temperatures. The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.

properties.Project name: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin
properties.Details: In the Lake Victoria Basin (LVB), climate change is inadequately integrated into regional transboundary water catchment management which is increasing the vulnerability of LVB communities. This problem is expected to intensify under the conditions of future climate change, specifically increasing variability in rainfall patterns and increasing mean annual temperatures. The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.

properties.Project name: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin
properties.Details: In the Lake Victoria Basin (LVB), climate change is inadequately integrated into regional transboundary water catchment management which is increasing the vulnerability of LVB communities. This problem is expected to intensify under the conditions of future climate change, specifically increasing variability in rainfall patterns and increasing mean annual temperatures. The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.

properties.Project name: Adapting to Climate Change in Lake Victoria Basin
properties.Details: In the Lake Victoria Basin (LVB), climate change is inadequately integrated into regional transboundary water catchment management which is increasing the vulnerability of LVB communities. This problem is expected to intensify under the conditions of future climate change, specifically increasing variability in rainfall patterns and increasing mean annual temperatures. The overall objective of this regional project is to reduce vulnerability to the negative effects of climate change in the five Lake Victoria Basin countries by building climate resilience.

properties.Project name: Enhancing climate resilience of rural communities living in protected areas
properties.Details: Rural communities in Cambodia are experiencing falling agricultural productivity as a changing climate leads to more erratic rainfall. The project aims to increase food supply and reduce soil erosion in several regions and national parks by restoring a variety of plant species to at least 1,875 hectares of degraded forests; enrichment planting of rice paddy boundaries and other cultivated areas with multi-use tree species that will enhance crop productivity; trial plots of several drought-tolerant hybrid rice cultivars; and intensifying and diversifying the productivity of at least 1,907 family agriculture areas in communities living around the forest sites.

properties.Project name: Mini-Grids Project
Developing agro-pastoral shade gardens as an adaptation strategy for poor rural communities
properties.Details: Over the past years, rainfall, although traditionally very limited, has been 75% below average in Djibouti. A total of 206,000 vulnerable people have been identified in Djibouti as now being affected by drought and its impact. This project aims to help these communities develop resilience to projected worsening of drought conditions by helping communities develop and maintain shade gardens based on date palms to serve as the foundation for a diversified, climate-resilient agricultural and pastoral economy.

properties.Project name: Climate Proofing of Agriculture in the Centre-Artibonite Loop
Dedicated Grant Mechanism for Local Communities
Enhancing climate and disaster resilience of the most vulnerable rural and emerging urban human settlements
properties.Details: Lao People’s Democratic Republic (PDR) is one of the most climate vulnerable countries in the world. This is mainly due to its high dependence on climate-sensitive natural resources and its low adaptive capacity. This project aims to enhance the climate and disaster resilience of the most vulnerable rural and emerging urban human settlements in Southern Lao PDR by increasing sustainable access to basic infrastructure systems and services, emphasizing resilience to storms, floods, droughts, landslides and disease outbreaks.

properties.Project name: Ecosystem-based adaptation at communities of the central forest corridor in Tegucigalpa
properties.Details: As climate change brings more extreme weather, residents in and around Honduras’ capital city have begun to struggle with adapting to the changing conditions. This projec aims to increase resilience to climate change and water-related risks for the most vulnerable population in Honduras through pilot activities and an overarching intervention to mainstream climate change considerations into water sector policies.

properties.Project name: Increasing climate resilience and enhancing sustainable land management in the southwest of Buenos Aires province
properties.Details: The soils in Argentina’s semi-arid Pampa regions are especially vulnerable to increasing climate variability and change. The project objective is to contribute to reduce climate and human induced vulnerability of the agroecosystems in the Southwest of the Buenos Aires Province by increasing adaptive capacity of key local institutions and actors, and piloting climate resilient and sustainable land management practices.

properties.Project name: Reducing risks and vulnerabilities from glacier lake outburst floods in northern Pakistan
properties.Details: The largest glaciers in the world outside the Polar Regions are in the Himalayan Karakorum Hindukush mountain ranges in northern Pakistan. This project aims to reduce risks and vulnerabilities from glacial lake outburst floods (GLOFs) and snow-melt flash floods in Northern Pakistan.

properties.Project name: Sustainable Energy Finance Program
Implementation of the Strategic Program for Climate Resilience (SPCR): Pacific Region
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Smallholder Forestry Program
Investment Project 1 “Promoting Climate Resilient Agriculture and Food Security”
Sustainable Energy Finance Program (VSEF)
Technical Assistance for Sustainable Geothermal Development Project
Technical Assistance: Mainstreaming Climate Resilience into Development Planning of Key Vulnerable Sectors
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Support for Forest Related Micro, Small, and Medium-sized Enterprises (MSMEs) in Ejidos
properties.Details: Capacity Building/Institutional Strengthening and Governance Reform

properties.Project name: Strategies for adaptation to climate change, for the preservation of livestock capital and livelihoods in highland rural communities
properties.Details: In Peru, raising Andean camelids is the main livelihood among the highland communities, with an estimated 1.5 million engaged in this activity. he project objective is to reduce vulnerability and increase adaptive capacity to respond to the impacts of climate change of the highland Andean peasant communities in the provinces of Arequipa, Caylloma, Castilla, La Union, and Condesuyos.

properties.Project name: Addressing climate change risks to farming systems at national and community level
properties.Details: To strengthen water management practices and legislation at the national and local levels in order to support the adoption of high efficiency irrigation techniques.

properties.Project name: Sustainable Rural Energization (ERUS) – Part I & III: Promoting Sustainable Business Models for Clean Cook stoves Dissemination
Energy Efficiency Program
Building adaptive capacities in communities, livelihoods and ecological security in the Kanha-Pench corridor in Madhya Pradesh
properties.Details: The KPC forms one of the most crucial tiger conservation units of the world, and also supports rich biodiversity and provides important ecosystem services like regulating hydrology and carbon sequestration. In the last two decades, the Kanha-Pench Corridor has faced severe degradation caused by an increase in anthropogenic pressure and climate change. The project will be implemented in 56 villages that lie in and around the KPC.

properties.Project name: Enhancing adaptive capacity and increasing resilience of amall and marginal farmers in Purulia and Bankura Districts of West Bengal
properties.Details: In West Bengal 17.4% of the total Net State Domestic Product and 70% of the total population, mainly the rural population, are dependent on climate sensitive sectors (such as agriculture including animal husbandry and horticulture, forestry and fisheries). This project aims to develop climate adaptive and resilient livelihood systems through diversification, technology adoption and natural resource management for rural small and marginal farmers associated with agriculture and allied sector in Lateritic Zone of West Bengal.

properties.Project name: Taking adaptation to the ground: a small grants facility for enabling local level responses to climate change
properties.Details: Climate change projections have indicated that both the Mopani District and the Namakwa District in South Africa will be subject to increasing temperatures and changing rainfall patterns. Greater amplitude of dry and wet spells, along with increasing temperatures, will negatively impact already stressed communities in both areas. The Community Adaptation Small Grants Facility (SGF) will increase climate resilience in rural communities and socio-economic systems in these two pilot district municipalities in South Africa by working directly with local stakeholders and anticipated beneficiaries through a small granting mechanism.

properties.Project name: Support to FIRA for the Implementation of an Energy Efficiency Financing Strategy for the Food Processing Industry
Climate Change Technical Assistance
properties.Details: Enabling Environment (including capacity development, policy and regulatory work)

properties.Project name: Environmental Land Management and Rural Livelihoods - AF
Lighting Ethiopia
Sustainable Energy Industry Development Project
Building adaptive capacities of small inland fishers for climate resilience and livelihood security in Madhya Pradesh
properties.Details: Madhya Pradesh is situated in the central region of India, and is the second largest state in the nation. Fisheries are a major source of employment for the rural population. The broad objective of the project is to make the fishery sector (captive inland fishery) adaptive to climate variability and enhance the adaptive capacity of the fish farmers to ensure their livelihood security in Madhya Pradesh, India.

properties.Project name: Irrigation Program
Geothermal Sector Strategy and Regulations
Project for Scaling Up Renewable Energy in Mali
Reducing vulnerability and increasing resilience of coastal communities in the Saloum Islands (Dionewar)
properties.Details: Climate change and climate variability are impeding development efforts on Dionewar Island on the west coast of Senegal. Under the combined effects of climate change and human activities, over 38% of the mangrove swamp in the Saloum estuary has disappeared according to the estimates. This project aims to address the threats posed by the dual effects of climate change and marine coastal erosion on the village of Dionewar.

properties.Project name: Climate proofing of watershed development projects in the states of Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu
properties.Details: Rajasthan is characterised by erratic and low rainfall with varying intensity and uneven distribution of heavy intensity rainfall in short spell. In addition, the steep slopes with sandy soils make livelihoods of small and marginal farmers from natural resources a very challenging task. Hence the central focus of this project is on works related to water and soil conservation and watershed development.

properties.Project name: Energy Infrastructure Program
Renewable Energy Integration-TA
M&E TA: Mainstreaming Climate Change Mitigation into National Infrastructure
Climate smart actions and strategies in north western Himalayan region for sustainable livelihoods of agriculture-dependent hill communities
properties.Details: Rising temperatures, changed precipitation conditions, and extreme weather events have increased the vulnerability of the communities in the Indian Himalayan Region and further accelerated the process of marginalization of hill communities. The project aims to improve the adaptive capacity of rural small and marginal farmers including hill women in North Western Himalayan region by introducing a combination of Climate Smart Farming Technologies along with required social engineering and capacity building processes.

properties.Project name: Kazakh Railways: Sustainable Energy Program
Conservation and management of coastal resources as a potential adaptation strategy for sea level rise
properties.Details: The Krishna delta region is highly vulnerable to the predicted changes in the climatic condition and sea level rise and associated extreme events such as cyclones and floods. The aim of the project is to overcome the consequences of salinization and other impacts of the coastal area due to sea level rise and seawater inundation due to increased cyclonic storms and storm surges through appropriate adaptation strategies such as restoration of degraded mangroves and demonstration of Integrated Mangrove Fishery Farming System (IMFFS).
